title: oc2rcli version 1.0 json schema
description: This schema is intended to validate all possible derived content for the OpenC2 Remote Command Line Interface

oneOf.description: A message defined by an Action-Target pair that is sent from a Producer and received by a Consumer
A message from a Consumer to a Producer acknowledging a Command or returning the requested resources or status to a previously received Command

OpenC2_Command.title: OpenC2 Command
OpenC2_Command.description: The Command defines an Action to be performed on a Target

action.description: The task or activity to be performed (i.e., the 'verb')

target.description: The object of the Action. The Action is performed on the Target

args.description: Additional information that applies to the Command

actuator.description: The subject of the Action. The Actuator executes the Action on the Target

status_text.description: A free-form human-readable description of the response status

results.description: Map of key:value pairs that contain additional results based on the invoking Command

oneOf.description: Initiate a request for information
Initiate an action
Stop an action
Delete an object
Copy an object

features.description: A set of items used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities

artifact.description: A set of items used with the query Action to determine an Actuator's capabilities

x-rcli:processes.description: It describes the service enviroment, its connections and security capabilities

x-rcli:files.description: It describes the service enviroment, its connections and security capabilities

x-rcli.description: Actuator specifiers defined in the rcli profile

response_requested.description: The type of Response required for the Command: none, ack, status, complete

start_time.description: The specific date/time to initiate the Action

stop_time.description: The specific date/time to terminate the Action

duration.description: The length of time for an Action to be in effect

x-rcli.description: Command Arguments defined in the rcli profile

oneOf.description: Processing -an interim response used to inform the Producer that the Consumer has accepted the Command but has not yet completed it
OK - the Command has succeeded
Bad Request - the Consumer cannot process the Command due to something that is perceived to be a Producer error (e.g., malformed Command syntax)
Unauthorized - the Command message lacks valid authentication credentials for the Target resource or authorization has been refused for the submitted credentials
Forbidden - the Consumer understood the Command but refuses to authorize it
Not Found - the Consumer has not found anything matching the Command
Internal Error - the Consumer encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from performing the Command
Not Implemented - the Consumer does not support the functionality required to perform the Command
Service Unavailable - the Consumer is currently unable to perform the Command due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the Consumer

versions.description: List of OpenC2 language versions supported by this Actuator

profiles.description: List of profiles supported by this Actuator

pairs.description: List of Targets applicable to each supported Action

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests per minute supported by design or policy

x-rcli.description: Response types defined in the rcli profile

Features.title: OpenC2 Features Items
Features.description: An array of zero to ten names used to query an Actuator for its supported capabilities

IPv4_Net.title: OpenC2 IPv4 Net
IPv4_Net.description: IPv4 address as defined in [RFC0791] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

IPv6_Net.title: OpenC2 IPv6 Net
IPv6_Net.description: IPv6 address as defined in [RFC8200] - CIDR prefix-length. If omitted, refers to a single host address

Duration.title: OpenC2 Duration
Duration.description: A length of time - number of milliseconds

DateTime.title: OpenC2 Date Time
DateTime.description: Date and Time - milliseconds since 00:00:00 UTC, 1 January 1970

Action_Targets.title: OpenC2 Action Target Pairs
Action_Targets.description: Map of each action supported by this Actuator to the list of Targets applicable to the specific Action

query.description: Initiate a request for information. Used to communicate the supported options and determine the state or settings

oneOf.description: A set of items such as Action/Target pairs, profiles versions, options that are supported by the Actuator
Information about one or more processes
Information about one or more files
Processes to be started
Processes to be stopped

copy.description: Send a file from Producer to Consumer

oneOf.description: Binary version of a file or URL
Files to be deleted
List of OpenC2 Language versions supported by this Actuator
List of profiles supported by this Actuator
List of supported Actions and applicable Targets
Maximum number of Commands per minute supported by design or policy

Hostname.title: OpenC2 Hostname
Hostname.description: Internet host name as specified in [RFC1123]

IDN_Hostname.title: OpenC2 Internationalized Hostname
IDN_Hostname.description: Internationalized Internet host name as specified in [RFC5890], Section 2.3.2.3

L4_Protocol.title: OpenC2 layer four protocol
L4_Protocol.description: Value of the protocol (IPv4) or next header (IPv6) field in an IP packet. Any IANA value - [RFC5237]

oneOf.description: Internet Control Message Protocol - [RFC0792]
Transmission Control Protocol - [RFC0793]
User Datagram Protocol - [RFC0768]
Stream Control Transmission Protocol - [RFC4960]

Nsid.title: Namespace Identifier
Nsid.description: A short identifier that refers to a namespace

File.title: OpenC2 File
File.$comment: Upgraded to require any one of these (or more), which is more useful

name.title: The name of the file as defined in the file system

path.title: The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system

hashes.title: One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents

Hashes.title: OpenC2 Hashes
Hashes.$comment: Upgrade to require at least one of (the spec allows it to be empty, but that is not useful)

md5.title: MD5 hash as defined in RFC 1321

sha1.title: SHA1 hash as defined in RFC 6234

sha256.title: SHA256 hash as defined in RFC 6234

mime_type.description: Permitted values specified in the IANA Media Types registry - [RFC6838]

payload.description: Choice of literal content or URL

bin.description: Specifies the data contained in the Artifact

url.description: MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the un-encoded content

rcli:Process.title: OpenC2 Process
rcli:Process.$comment: Upgraded to require at least one property specified

cwd.title: Current working directory of tshe process

executable.title: Executable that was executed to start the process

command_line.title: The full command line invocation used to start this process, including all arguments

oneOf.description: No response
Respond when Command received
Respond with progress toward Command completion
Respond when all aspects of Command completed

rcli:Processes.description: It describes the service enviroment, its connections and security capabilities

rcli:Files.description: It describes the service enviroment, its connections and security capabilities

storage.description: The response includes either only the name or all the details about the service and the links

rcli:State.title: process state
rcli:State.description: The observed state of a process, typically from the OS

sleeping.description: The process is sleeping and waiting for a resource.

stopped.description: The process has been stopped (e.g., via SIGSTOP).

zombie.description: The process has terminated but not been reaped by its parent.

dead.description: Dead process (should be gone but still in the process list).

suspended.description: Suspended state, often used by external tools.
